In future rounds, I will base my decisions on the results of this inquiry in conjunction with any new information that arises, adapting my strategy to identify key roles such as the medic or werewolves.

I choose to kill Player 1. My reason is: At this early stage of the game, since no additional information is available, I don't have any leads on who might be the medic or the seer. Therefore, I am making a somewhat random choice to avoid suspicion. Player 1 is as likely a candidate as any other non-werewolf player, and by attempting to eliminate them, I aim to reduce the number of villagers while preserving the fiction that I am not a werewolf. This aligns with my strategy to form alliances, preserve deception, and create confusion among the remaining players. Also, as the game just started, killing a player who has not had much chance to reveal their potential as a medic or seer could prevent the village from gaining a strategic advantage early in the game.

I choose to kill Player 0. My reason is: Since it is the first round, there is very limited information available about all players' roles. Player 0 has an unknown role with high confidence, similar to most other players, and nobody has an established belief about their role. This choice follows the strategy of creating confusion and deflecting suspicion away from werewolves. Additionally, by not targeting a player that has been vocal or suspected of being a villager, this maintains deception and does not immediately rally the players against the werewolves. Without any concrete leads on who might be the seer or medic at this point, a safe but random strike seems most prudent.
